sentence.text: Likewise, HCV replication is severely impaired within hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation) tissue in vivo, but the mechanisms responsible for this restriction are presently unknown.

Here, we identify tumor-associated calcium signal transducer 2 (TACSTD2), one of the most downregulated genes in primary phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation tissue, as a host factor that interacts with CLDN1 and cell-cell junction organization and regulates their cellular localization.
